title: Enlarge click target, add smooth scrolling, and add fast-mouse motion blur effect

requirements.text: Increase the size and hit area of the primary click target (the main "CLICK!" button) so it is noticeably bigger and easier to click/tap on both desktop and mobile, without breaking the existing centered layout.

quotes: the place where i click is smaller make it bigger

acceptanceCriteria: The main click button renders larger than before at all breakpoints (mobile + desktop).
Click/tap reliably registers across the entire visible button area; no dead zones near the edges.
The button remains centered in the middle column and does not overlap the Stats or Shop panels at common screen sizes.

requirements.text: Add smooth scrolling behavior for the gameâ€™s scrollable shop areas (the two ScrollArea lists) so mouse wheel/trackpad scrolling feels smooth and not jumpy.
acceptanceCriteria: Scrolling the Click Upgrades and Automation shop lists feels smooth (no abrupt jumps) when using mouse wheel/trackpad.
Smooth scrolling does not break keyboard scrolling (Arrow keys / PageDown) inside the shop lists.
If the user has reduced motion enabled, smooth scrolling is disabled or significantly reduced to respect the preference.

requirements.text: Add a fast-mouse-movement blur effect so that when the pointer moves quickly, a subtle motion blur/trail effect appears, and it fades away when the pointer slows down or stops.

quotes: and mouse blur when it is move fast

acceptanceCriteria: When the pointer moves quickly, a visible but subtle blur/trail effect appears near the cursor; when movement slows, the effect diminishes and disappears.
The effect does not interfere with clicking (must not block pointer events on underlying UI).
The effect respects prefers-reduced-motion (disabled when reduced motion is enabled).
The effect is performant (no noticeable frame drops during normal gameplay interactions).

constraints: Frontend code under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT must not be modified; compose existing UI components instead of editing them.
Do not introduce backend changes; this request is UI/UX only.
nonGoals: Adding new upgrades, currencies, or gameplay mechanics.
Changing the warm amber/orange visual theme or replacing generated art assets.
